Human-Powered Pollination: Train a team of humans to manually collect and transfer pollen between plants, ensuring the plants are pollinated without the need for flowers.
Genetic Engineering: Develop plants that can self-pollinate, eliminating the need for external pollinators.
Robotic Pollinators: Create robots that can navigate between plants, using their sensors to detect pollen and transfer it between plants.
Pollination Drones: Utilize drones equipped with pollen collection and deposition devices to pollinate plants in remote or hard-to-reach areas.
Pollination by Insects Other Than Bees: Identify and train other insects that can effectively pollinate plants, providing an alternative to bees.
